001package io.jstach.jstachio;
002
003import java.io.DataOutput;
004import java.io.IOException;
005import java.io.OutputStream;
006import java.nio.charset.Charset;
007
008import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
009
010import io.jstach.jstachio.Output.CloseableEncodedOutput;
011
012/**
013 * A low level abstraction and implementation detail analogous to {@link Appendable} and
014 * {@link DataOutput}.
015 *
016 * @author agentgt
017 * @param <E> the exception type that can happen on output
018 */
019public interface Output<E extends Exception> {
020
021        /**
022         * Analogous to {@link Appendable#append(CharSequence)}.
023         * @param s unlike appendable always non null.
024         * @throws E if an error happens while writting to the appendable
025         * @apiNote Implementations are required to implement this method.
026         */
027        public void append(CharSequence s) throws E;
028
029        /**
030         * Analogous to {@link Appendable#append(CharSequence)} which by default treats the
031         * String as a CharSequence.
032         * @param s unlike appendable always non null.
033         * @throws E if an error happens while writting to the appendable
034         * @apiNote Implementations are required to implement this method.
035         */
036        default void append(String s) throws E {
037                append((CharSequence) s);
038        }
039
040        /**
041         * Analogous to {@link Appendable#append(CharSequence, int, int)}.
042         * @param csq Unlike appendable never null.
043         * @param start start inclusive
044         * @param end end exclusive
045         * @throws E if an error happens while writting to the appendable
046         * @apiNote Implementations are required to implement this method.
047         */
048        public void append(CharSequence csq, int start, int end) throws E;
049
050        /**
051         * Appends a character to an appendable.
052         * @param c character
053         * @throws E if an error happens while writting to the appendable
054         * @apiNote Implementations are required to implement this method.
055         */
056
057        public void append(char c) throws E;
058
059        /**
060         * Write a short by using {@link String#valueOf(int)}
061         * @param s short
062         * @throws E if an error happens while writting to the appendable
063         */
064        default void append(short s) throws E {
065                append(String.valueOf(s));
066        }
067
068        /**
069         * Write a int by using {@link String#valueOf(int)}.
070         * <p>
071         * Implementations should override if they want different behavior or able to support
072         * appendables that can write the native type.
073         * @param i int
074         * @throws E if an error happens while writting to the appendable
075         */
076        default void append(int i) throws E {
077                append(String.valueOf(i));
078        }
079
080        /**
081         * Write a long by using {@link String#valueOf(long)}.
082         * <p>
083         * Implementations should override if they want different behavior or able to support
084         * appendables that can write the native type.
085         * @param l long
086         * @throws E if an error happens while writting to the appendable
087         */
088        default void append(long l) throws E {
089                append(String.valueOf(l));
090        }
091
092        /**
093         * Write a long by using {@link String#valueOf(long)}.
094         * <p>
095         * Implementations should override if they want different behavior or able to support
096         * appendables that can write the native type.
097         * @param d double
098         * @throws E if an error happens while writting to the appendable
099         */
100        default void append(double d) throws E {
101                append(String.valueOf(d));
102        }
103
104        /**
105         * Write a long by using {@link String#valueOf(long)}.
106         * <p>
107         * Implementations should override if they want different behavior or able to support
108         * appendables that can write the native type.
109         * @param b boolean
110         * @throws E if an error happens while writting to the appendable
111         */
112        default void append(boolean b) throws E {
113                append(String.valueOf(b));
114        }
115
116        /**
117         * Adapts an {@link OutputStream} as an {@link Output}.
118         * @param a the OutputStream to be wrapped.
119         * @param charset the encoding to use
120         * @return outputstream output
121         */
122        public static EncodedOutput<IOException> of(OutputStream a, Charset charset) {
123                return new OutputStreamOutput(a, charset);
124        }
125
126        /**
127         * Adapts an {@link Appendable} as an {@link Output}.
128         * @param a the appendable to be wrapped.
129         * @return string based output
130         */
131        public static Output<IOException> of(Appendable a) {
132                return new AppendableOutput(a);
133        }
134
135        /**
136         * Adapts a {@link StringBuilder} as an {@link Output}.
137         * @param a the StringBuilder to be wrapped.
138         * @return string based output
139         */
140        public static StringOutput of(StringBuilder a) {
141                return new StringOutput(a);
142        }
143
144        /**
145         * Converts the output to an appendable unless it already is one.
146         * @return adapted appendable of this output.
147         */
148        default Appendable toAppendable() {
149                if (this instanceof Appendable a) {
150                        return a;
151                }
152                return new OutputAppendable(this);
153        }
154
155        /**
156         * A specialized Output designed for pre-encoded templates that have already encoded
157         * byte arrays to be used directly.
158         *
159         * @author agentgt
160         * @param <E> the exception type
161         */
162        public interface EncodedOutput<E extends Exception> extends Output<E> {
163
164                /**
165                 * Analogous to {@link OutputStream#write(byte[])}. Implementations should not
166                 * alter the byte array.
167                 * @param bytes already encoded bytes
168                 * @throws E if an error happens
169                 */
170                public void write(byte[] bytes) throws E;
171
172                /**
173                 * Analogous to {@link OutputStream#write(byte[], int, int)}. Generated templates
174                 * do not call this method as great care as to be taken to preserve the encoding.
175                 * It is only provided in the case of future found optimizations and is not
176                 * currently required.
177                 * <p>
178                 * The default implementation creates an array copies the data and then calls
179                 * {@link #write(byte[])}.
180                 * @param bytes already encoded bytes
181                 * @param off offset
182                 * @param len length to copy
183                 * @throws E if an error happens
184                 */
185                default void write(byte[] bytes, int off, int len) throws E {
186                        byte[] dest = new byte[len];
187                        System.arraycopy(bytes, off, dest, 0, len);
188                        write(dest);
189                }
190
191                @Override
192                default void append(char c) throws E {
193                        append(String.valueOf(c));
194                }
195
196                @Override
197                default void append(String s) throws E {
198                        write(s.getBytes(charset()));
199                }
200
201                @Override
202                default void append(CharSequence csq, int start, int end) throws E {
203                        append(csq.subSequence(start, end).toString());
204                }
205
206                /**
207                 * The charset that the encoded output <em>should</em> be.
208                 * @return expected charset
209                 */
210                Charset charset();
211
212                /**
213                 * Adapts an {@link OutputStream} as an {@link EncodedOutput}. The resulting
214                 * output can be closed and will close the passed in OutputStream.
215                 * @param a the OutputStream to be wrapped.
216                 * @param charset the encoding to use
217                 * @return outputstream output
218                 */
219                public static CloseableEncodedOutput<IOException> of(OutputStream a, Charset charset) {
220                        return new OutputStreamOutput(a, charset);
221                }
222
223        }
224
225        /**
226         * An encoded output that can be closed. This maybe to close downstream outputstreams
227         * or to signify ready for reuse or to clear buffers.
228         *
229         * @author agent
230         * @param <E> error on close
231         */
232        public interface CloseableEncodedOutput<E extends Exception> extends EncodedOutput<E>, AutoCloseable {
233
234                @Override
235                public void close() throws E;
236
237        }
238
239        /**
240         * String Builder based output.
241         *
242         * @author agentgt
243         *
244         */
245        public class StringOutput implements Output<RuntimeException> {
246
247                private final StringBuilder buffer;
248
249                /**
250                 * Create using supplied StringBuilder.
251                 * @param buffer never null.
252                 */
253                public StringOutput(StringBuilder buffer) {
254                        super();
255                        this.buffer = buffer;
256                }
257
258                @Override
259                public void append(CharSequence s) {
260                        buffer.append(s);
261                }
262
263                @Override
264                public void append(String s) {
265                        buffer.append(s);
266                }
267
268                @Override
269                public void append(CharSequence csq, int start, int end) {
270                        buffer.append(csq, start, end);
271
272                }
273
274                @Override
275                public void append(char c) {
276                        buffer.append(c);
277
278                }
279
280                @Override
281                public String toString() {
282                        return buffer.toString();
283                }
284
285                @Override
286                public void append(boolean b) throws RuntimeException {
287                        buffer.append(b);
288                }
289
290                @Override
291                public void append(double d) throws RuntimeException {
292                        buffer.append(d);
293                }
294
295                @Override
296                public void append(int i) throws RuntimeException {
297                        buffer.append(i);
298                }
299
300                @Override
301                public void append(long l) throws RuntimeException {
302                        buffer.append(l);
303                }
304
305                @Override
306                public void append(short s) throws RuntimeException {
307                        buffer.append(s);
308                }
309
310                /**
311                 * The buffer that has been wrapped.
312                 * @return the wrapped builder
313                 */
314                public StringBuilder getBuffer() {
315                        return buffer;
316                }
317
318        }
319
320}
321
322class OutputAppendable implements Appendable {
323
324        private final Output<?> output;
325
326        public OutputAppendable(Output<?> output) {
327                super();
328                this.output = output;
329        }
330
331        @Override
332        public Appendable append(@Nullable CharSequence csq) throws @Nullable IOException {
333                try {
334                        output.append(csq);
335                        return this;
336                }
337                catch (Exception e) {
338                        if (e instanceof IOException ioe) {
339                                throw ioe;
340                        }
341                        throw new IOException(e);
342                }
343        }
344
345        @Override
346        public Appendable append(@Nullable CharSequence csq, int start, int end) throws IOException {
347                try {
348                        output.append(csq, start, end);
349                        return this;
350                }
351                catch (Exception e) {
352                        if (e instanceof IOException ioe) {
353                                throw ioe;
354                        }
355                        throw new IOException(e);
356                }
357        }
358
359        @Override
360        public Appendable append(char c) throws IOException {
361                try {
362                        output.append(c);
363                        return this;
364                }
365                catch (Exception e) {
366                        if (e instanceof IOException ioe) {
367                                throw ioe;
368                        }
369                        throw new IOException(e);
370                }
371        }
372
373}
374
375class AppendableOutput implements Output<IOException> {
376
377        private final Appendable appendable;
378
379        public AppendableOutput(Appendable appendable) {
380                super();
381                this.appendable = appendable;
382        }
383
384        @Override
385        public void append(CharSequence s) throws IOException {
386                appendable.append(s);
387        }
388
389        @Override
390        public void append(CharSequence csq, int start, int end) throws IOException {
391                appendable.append(csq, start, end);
392
393        }
394
395        @Override
396        public void append(char c) throws IOException {
397                appendable.append(c);
398
399        }
400
401}
402
403class OutputStreamOutput implements CloseableEncodedOutput<IOException> {
404
405        private final OutputStream outputStream;
406
407        private final Charset charset;
408
409        public OutputStreamOutput(OutputStream outputStream, Charset charset) {
410                super();
411                this.outputStream = outputStream;
412                this.charset = charset;
413        }
414
415        @Override
416        public void write(byte[] b) throws IOException {
417                outputStream.write(b);
418        }
419
420        @Override
421        public void write(byte[] bytes, int off, int len) throws IOException {
422                outputStream.write(bytes, off, len);
423        }
424
425        @Override
426        public void append(CharSequence csq) throws IOException {
427                append(csq.toString());
428        }
429
430        @Override
431        public void append(String s) throws IOException {
432                write(s.getBytes(charset));
433        }
434
435        @Override
436        public Charset charset() {
437                return charset;
438        }
439
440        @Override
441        public void close() throws IOException {
442                outputStream.close();
443        }
444
445}
